html:
taken away for nought. Physically, the enemies of Israel captured the Israelites and took them away without paying for them, as they would have done with legally held slaves. Spiritually, Satan took Israel captive and gave them nothing in return, as he continues to do with people of the covenant in our own day.

they that rule over them. Israel was in bondage to both earthly and spiritual powers.

howl. The oppressors cause them to cry out in agony.

my name…blasphemed. The name of God is often abused, which is why the Lord said, "Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain" (Ex. 20:7). It is uncertain here whether those in bondage blame the Lord for their plight, or whether the oppressors blaspheme God's name by mocking him and those they hold captive.
